STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
January 15, 2025
Ellen Louise Westgate
Catholic Social Services of Washtenaw
4925 Packard St.
Ann Arbor, MI, 48108-1521
Re: License #: CB810201018
Dear Ms. Westgate:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
1/10/2025. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action
plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and
must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Samantha Way, area manager at 517- 243- 9743.
Sincerely,
Pinkey Brown, Licensing Consultant
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the following:
CPA Rule 400.12212 Personnel records
• (2) The personnel record must contain all the
following information before employment may
occur:
• (d) Three references obtained from persons
who are unrelated to the staff person.
One of four personnel files reviewed did not contain three references as the rule
required.
CPA Rule 400.12418 Development of service plans
• (5) An agency shall involve the child's parent or
parents and the foster parents in the development
of service plans to enable the parent or parents
and foster parents to understand the plan for the
child and the parents' and the foster parent's role
in assisting the agency in carrying out the plan. An
agency shall give a copy to and review the parent-
agency treatment plan with the parent or parents
and foster parents. The agency must inform the
parent or parents and foster parent that the
information in the parent-agency treatment plan
2

and any other information about the child and the
child's family is confidential.
Three of three foster care files reviewed did not indicate that the parents’ and/or
foster parents were involved in the child’s parent -agency treatment plan. There was
no information to determine that the plans were developed and reviewed with the
parents and/or foster parents.
CPA Rule 400.12421 Visitation and family time; in person contact
• (2) An agency social service worker shall visit
the foster child, and the foster parent, if
applicable, in the child's placement at least
once every month.
Two of three foster care files reviewed did not visit the child in the foster child
placement at least once a month.
REPEAT VIOLATION
12/27/23 Renewal, CAP approved 1/19/24
CPA Rule 400.12605 Adoptive family evaluation
• (1) An agency social service worker shall
complete a written adoptive evaluation within 90
days of the family signing an adoption application
and prior to approving a family for adoption.
One of three adoptive family evaluation reviewed was not completed within the
required time frame.
REPEAT VIOLATION
12/27/23 Renewal, CAP approved 1/19/24
3

IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas.
• Technical assistance was not requested or required.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• Medical Passports- Program Office has advised that Medical Passports
must be updated and saved in MiSACWIS quarterly, for all youth, even if
signatures are not required at the time.
• Program Office requires that FTMs (1105) are to be completed prior to the
updated service plans.
VI. EVALUATION OF PERIOD UNDER REVIEW
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted one acceptable corrective action plan (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with this CAP is as follows: One CAP submitted
was in response to the 2023 renewal inspection completed on 12/27/2023 and the
CAP was approved on 1/19/2024. The agency was cited with six violations. The
agency has made some improvement with violations. However, two of the six
violations are repeat violations during this reporting period.
There were no special investigations initiated during this reporting period.
Chief Administrator Assessment:
The Chief Administrator Assessment was reviewed onsite. The Chief
Administrator (CA) reported the assessment has determined the implementation
of the CAP was beneficial in establishing and maintaining compliance with
licensing rules. The CA barrier focused on being understaffed and being down two
foster care workers. The agency has hired one foster care worker and in the
process of hiring another foster care worker in the near future.
Financial Overview:
Reviewed the agency independent auditor’s report dated December 31, 2023, and
2022, and the agency annual financial report. There were no financial concerns
identified.
1

Staff Interviews:
Staff interviews did not identify any areas of concerns. However, it was suggested
that when a staff member is newly hired the staff receives some type of
interaction/activity among departments to get to know their coworkers who work in
the agency and varies programs.
Description of Agency Walk Through:
The agency has the space and equipment needed to perform job requirements.
The files are stored securely to prevent unauthorized access.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
The DCWL Analyst identified one safety concern:
Safety Alert: The foster home had no operable smoke detector and no operable
carbon monoxide detector in the foster home.
Resolution: Safety alert was resolved on 11/1/24 with a home visit by the foster care
worker. The smoke detector and carbon monoxide detectors were installed in the
home. Photos were taken with operable detectors and a social work contact was
entered in MiSACWIS. Photos are attached to the safety alert and in MiSACWIS.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
January 14, 2025
__________________________________________________________________
Pinkey Brown Date
